results.firPara: This Italy squad lack star names up front – and in midfield – but, if Antonio Conte finds the right tactics, they should reach the knockout stages at least
results.secPara: This article is part of the Guardians Euro 2016 Experts Network, a cooperation between some of the best media organisations from the countries who have qualified for France. theguardian.com is running previews from three countries each day in the run-up to the tournament kicking off on 10 June.
results.webTitle: Italy Euro 2016 team guide: tactics, key players and expert predictions

results.firPara: I am very much enjoying the England Euro 2016 squads shtick of proudly sneaking a large toy lion into every team photo, which gives them the flavour of 23 Minnesotan dentists on a trophy-hunting safari. They seem certain to return triumphantly home with these subjugated beasts, whose heads will presumably end up mounted on the walls of a St Georges Park den that also features the stuffed careers of various managers, and an umbrella stand fashioned from the foot of Steve McClaren.
results.secPara: Infinitely less enchanting is the confected row about an England players delegations failure to visit the Thiepval Memorial to the missing Somme dead. Whenever I read a version of this story, which is to say whenever the England football side find themselves within a 200-mile radius of a battlefield or death camp, I get genuinely misty-eyed and overcome by a single thought Never again. Never again should any visit by any England side to anywhere vaguely near some bottomless historical horror be telescoped down into a crass dig at their imagined slight toward those that paid the ultimate sacrifice. Why didnt the players go? Why did only some of them go? Why did they wear tracksuits? OH MY GOD WERE THERE BEATS HEADPHONES ON THE BUS?
results.webTitle: England memorial row is the real insult to Somme victims | Marina Hyde

results.firPara: This article is part of the Guardians Euro 2016 Experts Network, a cooperation between some of the best media organisations from the countries who have qualified for France. theguardian.com is running previews from three countries each day in the run-up to the tournament kicking off on 10 June.
results.secPara: He has some Kompany in him. His nickname (the new Kompany), his club (Manchester City), his position (central defender), his skills (strong, fast, technically good), his origin (a Brussels ketje from a mixed family) and this summer he could also replace him in the national team. Lets introduce you to Jason Denayer, a warrior trained in bare feet.
results.webTitle: Jason Denayer: Belgium’s barefoot warrior ready to be the new Kompany

results.secPara: Belgium go in to the tournament ranked No2 in the world but the foundations are showing cracks. Marc Wilmots has had to reorganise his defence completely after losing his charismatic leader Vincent Kompany and Nicolas Lombaerts, his second-choice centre-back.
results.webTitle: Belgium Euro 2016 team guide: tactics, key players and expert predictions

results.firPara: After a tepid loss in their opening Copa América Centenario game put them under threat of elimination, the US needed a riposte against Costa Rica on Tuesday. They delivered a renaissance.
results.secPara: The same players who had disappointed against Colombia last Friday delivered in Chicago. Michael Bradley was a potent midfield puppeteer, setting up a forward line that now worked in unison rather than isolation. The attack had sly ideas and a serrated edge.
results.webTitle: USA use style and guile to thrash Costa Rica in Copa América

results.firPara: Post-game thoughts And the US are (temporarily) top of the group. Its perhaps a testament to how the players feel about their coach that they put in that performance tonight. A great reaction for a team under pressure while hosting a tournament. Costa Rica were great for the first five minutes and largely absent for the next 85, a strange performance from a team that have shown they can raise their games on the big stage. Jones, Johnson and Dempsey were excellent for the US. And now its Paraguay next - on this evidence, the US should have few troubles.
results.secPara: The US finish things off with a free-kick on the edge of the area. Johnson will take ... but it smacks into the wall and out for a coner. That will not be taken - the ref (and Costa Rica) have seen enough and the whistle is blown.
results.webTitle: USA 4-0 Costa Rica: Copa América – as it happened

results.firPara: Manchester City are interested in signing the Borussia Dortmund striker Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang but would have to pay in the region of £55m for the Gabon international. The forward, who scored 36 goals for the Bundesliga club last season, would consider a move to join up with Pep Guardiola at City despite interest from Liverpool, Arsenal and Chelsea.
results.secPara: Aubameyang, 26, has four years left on his contract after signing an extension at Dortmund last year, and has recently talked up a move to Real Madrid but is also keen to play in the Premier League. He could become another high-profile signing from Dortmund for Guardiola, who sanctioned a deal for Ilkay Gundogan from the same club last week.
results.webTitle: Manchester City want Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang but will have to pay £55m

results.firPara: Danny Rose is poised to start Englands opening Group B fixture against Russia on Saturday after the other left-back in the squad, Ryan Bertrand, was again limited to peripheral involvement in training at Stade de Bourgognes as he recovers from a calf complaint.
results.secPara: Bertrand had initially been expected to start at Marseilles Stade Vélodrome having impressed at Southampton during the league season. However, having won his eighth cap in the friendly victory against Australia at the Stadium of Light, the 26-year-old sustained the injury in training and was forced to miss last Thursdays Wembley send-off win against Portugal.
results.webTitle: England likely to open Euro 2016 with Danny Rose and Kyle Walker at full-back
